alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity; Southern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 27 at 12:17PM PDT until March 29 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 24 inches. Higher snow amounts will occur across taller ridges. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Trinity county. This includes much of Highways 3, 36, and 36 and the towns of Trinity Center, Coffee Creek, Weaverville and Hayfork. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
